original: Hörby, Malmöh. 1., av rektor Gust. H. o. Ida Nife’son. — Stud:ex. i Lunid 25, fiil. mag, där 30, provår 36. Res. t. Tyskl. 23, 30, 33, 34, 36, 39 o. 45, Schweiz 23, 37, 46 o. 47, Engl, Belg. o. Holl. 33, Tjeckoslov. 34, Ungern o. Estl. s. å., Frankr. 37, 38, 46 o. 47, Ital. 38. Lär:tjg. i Kalmar 31-32, Karlskoga 32-33, Karilistads folksk:-iSem. 33-35, i Sthlm 37-38, adj. v. Jön-’köp. h. a. 1. 37, dito v. För;sv. ilärov. i Upps. 43, adj. i moder,sm. o. tyska v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 46, därjämte lär. v. flottans und:off:sk. i Sthlm 42-45. Förest, f. byrån av Gorresp. Scolaire Internat. sed. 37, ,sv. repr. i Federation Internat. des Organ, de Gorresp. et Échanges Scolaires fr. 47. Skr.: ett 50-tal upps. o. rec.
translated: Hörby, Malmöhus county. Firstborn of headmaster Gust. H. and Ida Nife. Passed studentexamen in Lund in 1925, fil. mag. in 1930, and took a trial year in 1936. Traveled to Germany in 1923, 1930, 1933, 1934, 1936, 1939, and 1945; Switzerland in 1923, 1937, 1946, and 1947; England, Belgium, and Holland in 1933; Czechoslovakia in 1934; Hungary and Estonia in the same year; France in 1937, 1938, 1946, and 1947; and Italy in 1938. Taught in Kalmar from 1931 to 1932, Karlskoga from 1932 to 1933, Karlstad's elementary teacher's seminary from 1933 to 1935, and in Stockholm from 1937 to 1938. Assistant teacher in Jönköping high school in 1937, and the same position in defense education in Uppsala in 1943. Also assistant teacher in modern language and German in Hvitfeldtska Gymnasiet in Gothenburg since 1946, in addition to teaching at the navy's officer candidate school in Stockholm from 1942 to 1945. Head of the office of Gorresp. Scolaire Internat. since 1937 and Swedish representative in Federation Internat. des Organ, de Gorresp. et Échanges Scolaires since 1947. Has written about fifty papers and reviews. Married in 19xx.

memberOf.name: Federation Internat. des Organ, de Gorresp. et Échanges Scolaires
